member.summary: Provides access to the LCD Screen Controller.

member.param: LCD configuration stucture containing LCD configuration information to be set.
member.returns: true if configurations were updated. false if configurations did not change.

member.param: true if LCD enable is a fixed state. false if LCD enable is managed by LCD controller.
true if active state is high.
true if active state is high.
true if active state is high.
true if your LCD clocks data on the rising edge of the LCD clock.
Horizontal Sync pulse width in clock cycles.
Horizontal back porch in clock cycles.
Horizontal front porch in clock cycles.
Vertical Sync pulse width given by number of lines.
Vertical back porch given by number of lines.
Vertical front porch given by number of lines.

member.name: F:GHI.OSHW.Hardware.LCDController.Configurations.PriorityEnable
member.remarks: This is only supported on EMX. By setting this flag to true, the LCD controller will get the highest priority for the processor which will significantly reduce the general performance of the system for other processes. This feature is usually used for displays that require very high refresh rates such as VGA displays.

member.name: F:GHI.OSHW.Hardware.LCDController.Configurations.OutputEnableIsFixed
member.summary: true if LCD enable is a fixed state. false if LCD enable is managed by LCD controller.
member.remarks: For ChipworkX, LCD Enable is PB3. If Enable is fixed, no changes are done for PB3 and it can be used as a regular I/O. If Enable is not fixed, LCD Enable is handled by the LCD controller directly.

member.name: F:GHI.OSHW.Hardware.LCDController.Configurations.OutputEnablePolarity
member.summary: true if active state is high.

member.summary: true if active state is high.

member.name: F:GHI.OSHW.Hardware.LCDController.Configurations.VerticalSyncPolarity
member.summary: true if active state is high.

member.name: F:GHI.OSHW.Hardware.LCDController.Configurations.PixelPolarity
member.summary: true if your LCD clocks data on the rising edge of the LCD clock.

member.summary: Horizontal Sync pulse width in clock cycles.

member.summary: Horizontal back porch in clock cycles.

member.summary: Sets certain bits in the register using a mask.

Bits of value 1 in mask are set in the register.
Bits of value 0 in mask are not changed.

member.summary: Clears certain bits in the register using a mask.
member.remarks:
Bits of value 1 in mask are cleared in the register.
Bits of value 0 in mask are not changed.

member.name: M:GHI.OSHW.Hardware.LowLevel.Register.ToggleBits(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Toggles certain bits in the register using a mask.
member.remarks:
Bits of value 1 in mask are toggled in the register.
Bits of value 0 in mask are not changed.

member.name: T:GHI.OSHW.Hardware.SoftwareI2CBus
member.summary: Master I2C bus functionality implemented in software.
member.remarks:
This class provides I2C functionality on any two digital pins. It is implemented by toggling the pins using software. It only supports one master on the same bus. Multiple masters on different buses work correctly.
You must provide two pins: one for I2C clock and one for I2C data. The user must connect external pull-up resistors on the pins as required for I2C operation.
Currently, only 7-bit I2C addresses are supported.
Clock rate is currently ignored. Specify 0 for this field. This will make the rate as fast as possible.

member.name: M:GHI.OSHW.Hardware.SoftwareI2CBus.#ctor(Microsoft.SPOT.Hardware.Cpu.Pin,Microsoft.SPOT.Hardware.Cpu.Pin)
member.summary: Creates an I2C bus using the clock and data pins.

member.name: M:GHI.OSHW.Hardware.SoftwareI2CBus.CreateI2CDevice(System.UInt16,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an I2C device on the bus.
member.param: Address of the device. This must be a 7 bit address.
Clock rate in KHz. Currently ignored. Specify 0 to go as fast as possible.

member.name: M:GHI.OSHW.Hardware.SoftwareI2CBus.DirectI2CWriteRead(Microsoft.SPOT.Hardware.Cpu.Pin,Microsoft.SPOT.Hardware.Cpu.Pin,System.Int32,System.UInt16,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Processes I2C directly without creating objects.
member.returns: true if all the required bytes are written and read successfully.
member.remarks: Do not use this method. It is intended for internal use only. See CreateI2CDevice instead.

member.name: T:GHI.OSHW.Hardware.SoftwareI2CBus.I2CDevice
member.summary: Represents an I2C device on a bus.

member.name: M:GHI.OSHW.Hardware.SoftwareI2CBus.I2CDevice.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a data buffer to the I2C device.

member.name: M:GHI.OSHW.Hardware.SoftwareI2CBus.I2CDevice.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a data buffer from the I2C device.

member.name: M:GHI.OSHW.Hardware.SoftwareI2CBus.I2CDevice.WriteRead(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Writes a data buffer then reads a data buffer from the I2C device.
member.returns: true if all the required bytes are written and read successfully.

member.name: T:GHI.OSHW.Hardware.StorageDev
member.summary: Allows SD Card blockstorage to be added in realtime after system is booted

member.summary: Allows SD Card blockstorage to be added in realtime after system is booted
member.remarks: A failed mount will raise a CLR_E_FAIL exception

member.summary: Allows SD Card blockstorage to be added in realtime after system is booted, specifying clock frequency in KHz
member.param: Specify the SD Card's clock frequency in KHz
member.remarks: A failed mount will raise a CLR_E_FAIL exception

member.name: M:GHI.OSHW.Hardware.StorageDev.MountSDToSystem
member.summary: Allows SD Card blockstorage to be added in realtime after system is booted
member.remarks: A failed mount will raise a CLR_E_FAIL exception

member.summary: Allows SD Card blockstorage to be added in realtime after system is booted, specifying clock frequency in KHz
member.param: Specify the SD Card's clock frequency in KHz
member.remarks: A failed mount will raise a CLR_E_FAIL exception

member.name: M:GHI.OSHW.Hardware.StorageDev.UnmountSD
member.summary: Allows SD Card blockstorage to be removed in realtime without a system reboot

member.name: M:GHI.OSHW.Hardware.Util.BitmapConvertBPP(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],GHI.OSHW.Hardware.Util.BPP_Type)
member.summary: Converts Bitmap pixel bytes into different BPP representation.

member.name: F:GHI.OSHW.Hardware.Util.BPP_Type.BPP1_x128
member.summary: 1 BPP for displays of 128 width and 128 or 64 height. The 1-bit pixel is set if the bitmap pixel has any color besides black.
